line.en: 'I opened my eyes.'
I close my eyes and roll over in bed, but it\ndoesn't feel like my sleepiness is coming back.
I sit up and open the curtains.
The sky is still dark. I can see the stars\ntwinkling.
I take a look outside, and I see Kotori staring\nup at the sky in the middle of the garden.
'How is it?'
'Aoi... Oh, it doesn't look like anything's going\nto happen.'
'I see.'
I take a look at the sky.
All I can see is the shining stars, with no sign\nof the clouds we are looking for.
It was quiet.
So quiet that it feels like we can hear the stars\ntwinkling.
'...Do you think it will happen?'
'I don't know, but maybe.'
'If it really happens, this would be the best\nsummer holiday ever.'
'Yeah.'
'But even if it were not to happen, it would\nstill be the best summer holiday ever for me.'
Summer holidays are always fun, but this was so\nfun it could be the best ever.
'Me too... I hadn't felt like this for a long\ntime.'
'I'm sad to think that summer holidays will be\nover...'
'Is there anybody who doesn't feel like that?'
Kotori shakes her head.
'Since I injured my legs, the end of summer\nholidays mean the start of a new school term.'
'I have to go back to school which I hate so\nmuch. That's why... I don't want it to end.'
'...That's the only reason.'
'But now, it's different.'
'This summer holiday is so fun... too fun, I\ndon't want it to end.'
Summer will come again.
As long as we are alive, dozens times more.
But this year, the best summer holiday ever, will\nonly happen once.
'It's not good, isn't it? For something to be so\nfun. I think I'm gonna be burned out in the\nsecond term.'
As I speak, Kotori giggles.
'You know, I think of Isuka as my friend too...'
'Your friend?'
Kotori nods her head, looking quite embarrassed.
'Isuka wrote in her flight log '...At some point,\nI won't be able to stay here', don't you\nremember?'
'Yeah, I remember.'
The same kind of thing was written several times.
'When I read that... it reminded me of myself.'
'I feel the same way. Sometime, I have to leave\nhere too...'

Kotori, who is disabled, and didn't really fit
into the class was seriously thinking about
quitting school around the time I came to the
dormitory.
For a long time she felt like she 'had to get out\nof there', and she felt the same thing when\nreading Isuka's flight log.
'So, you copied her by making that list?'
'The 'Things I want to do' list that Isuka wrote,\nis something she pursue herself.
'...Yeah.'

'At that time, I didn't even have a single
friend. So when I read Isuka's flight log, I
thought of her as my friend, and that... helped
ease my loneliness.'
'Now that I think about it, it's pretty stupid.'
'That's not true.'
'Because you felt like that, we're here now.'
'I guess so...'
'That's why I... Amane is different, but I feel\nthat Isuka's dream is being fulfilled.'
'As her friend...'
'Really...'
'Right...'
I also have special feelings about Isuka.
She is Amane's best friend, and she left the\nglider behind for us.
Also, now I know that to Kotori, who was once so\nlonely, She was like an invinsible friend.
To Amane, Kotori and I, Isuka is a beloved\nfriend.
That's why I feel like I owe a lot to Isuka.
'Eh heh heh... I just confessed something quite\nembarrassing.'
'Then why do you look so happy?'
'...I wonder. I couldn't stop myself from telling\nyou.'
'Isn't that because we're close friends?'
I said it as a joke, but Kotori, who's sitting in\nher wheelchair, looks downwards.
'R...right, maybe... (blushing)'
She looks kind of awkward and embarassed, but\nhappily accepted me using the phrase 'close\nfriend'.
'But the fact that I'm still here, and having\nsuch an amazing summer, is all because of you,\nAoi...'
'Thank you...'
'Sure.'
I meekly replied but inside, I answered 'That's\nmy line'.
If it weren't for Kotori, I would never have come\ninto contact with the glider.
Even if I had come across it, it wouldn't have as\nmuch fun.
'It's dawn.'
The eastern sky has a kind of hazy brightness.
'Shall we get breakfast ready?'
'OK.'
Everyone will be getting up soon.
Then, another busy day will begin.
